title: Communication Disorders
description: Professionals address a wide range of communication disorders including speech sound production (e.g., articulation, apraxia, dysarthria), resonance issues (hypernasality, hyponasality), voice, fluency (stuttering), and language (comprehension, expression, semantics, pragmatics, and syntax).

title: Cognitive-Communication Disorders
description: Therapy addresses attention, memory, problem-solving, and executive functioning difficulties, significantly impacting daily communication and requiring tailored interventions.

title: Swallowing and Feeding
description: Professionals diagnose and treat swallowing disorders (dysphagia), offering interventions for the oral, pharyngeal, and esophageal stages to ensure safe eating and drinking.

title: Hearing Healthcare
description: Services include assessment, diagnosis, and management of hearing disorders through evaluations, auditory rehabilitation, and the use of hearing aids and assistive devices.

title: Mental Health and Communication
description: Professionals help individuals facing communication difficulties due to mental health conditions such as depression, anxiety, and schizophrenia, improving emotional expression and social interaction.

title: Augmentative and Alternative Communication (AAC)
description: Support is provided for individuals with severe communication disorders through AAC tools like speech-generating devices and communication boards to aid in expression.

title: Language Development and Intervention for Children
description: Early intervention services are offered for children with speech and language delays, supporting development and effective communication at home and school.

title: Voice and Speech Rehabilitation for Medical Conditions
description: Rehabilitation services are provided for individuals recovering from stroke, cancer, TBI, or vocal cord surgeries to restore communication abilities.

title: Burn, Cleft Lip/Palate, and Craniofacial Anomalies
description: Therapists support individuals with cleft lip/palate, burns, and craniofacial anomalies, improving articulation, swallowing, and addressing social-emotional needs.

title: Disfluency and Stuttering
description: Therapy focuses on improving fluency and confidence in individuals with stuttering and other disfluency disorders using behavioral and cognitive techniques.

title: Multidisciplinary Collaboration
description: Professionals collaborate with physiotherapists, occupational therapists, psychologists, and doctors to provide holistic treatment for complex or multiple disorders.

title: Screening and Early Detection
description: Involves early screening of newborns, children, and adults to detect communication or hearing issues early, ensuring timely intervention.

title: Educational and Behavioral Support
description: Therapists support educational settings through IEPs and behavioral interventions to assist students with communication and hearing impairments.

title: Prevention and Public Health Initiatives
description: Includes advocacy for safe hearing practices, noise reduction, and public awareness campaigns to prevent speech, language, and hearing disorders.

title: Rehabilitation for Cochlear Implant Users
description: Rehabilitation services include auditory training and speech therapy for individuals adapting to cochlear implants, supporting successful hearing outcomes.

title: Geriatric Communication and Swallowing Care
